dmca.title: ThePlanetAbuse-C3378344F] FW: Invalid use of copyrighted material
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Dan Gaul [mailto:dan@digitaltrends.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, March 13, 2007 11:50 AM
To: Copyright
Subject: Re: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3378344F] FW: Invalid use of copyrighted
material

I'm the complaining party, and I'm an owner, and I'm a copyright holder
of
the content I'm complaining about.  Gadgetinsight.com does NOT have
permission to use our content, nor do they have permission to try to
claim
they have copyright on the material.

Please take my previous and this email as my statement that the below
information that gadgetinsight.com does not have permission to use,
reproduce or distribute our content, images or articles.

We want ALL Digital Trends and Designtechnica content removed from
gadgetinsight, wether it's referenced below or not, and they do not have
permission to reproduce, publish, or copy our content in the future.

The Planet may call me at anytime at my direct line at our office at
503-342-2883.

What else do I need to do?

Thanks,
Dan Gaul
503-342-2883

On 3/13/07 7:39 AM, "Copyright" <copyright@theplanet.com> wrote:

> Dear Mr. Gaul:
> 
> Please see below the requirements that are missing from your
complaint:
> 
> A statement that the complaining party has a good faith belief that
use
> of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the
> copyright owner, its agent, or the law; and
> 
> A statement that the information in the notification is accurate, and
> under penalty of perjury, that the complaining party is authorized to
> act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly
> infringed.
> 
> Legal Response Team
> 
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Dan Gaul [mailto:dan@digitaltrends.com]
> Sent: Monday, March 12, 2007 5:53 PM
> To: Copyright
> Cc: Horzepa, Joseph
> Subject: Re: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3378344F] FW: Invalid use of copyrighted
> material
> 
> I'm not sure what is missing here to complete the request. Can you
> please be
> bit more specific?  I used the DMCA pdf you referenced below as
> reference
> when writing the email.
> 
> -dan
> 
> 
> On 3/11/07 4:01 PM, "zzzzzz" <copyright@theplanet.com> wrote:
> 
>> To Whom It May Concern:
>> 
>> Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does
> not
>> substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
>> Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").
>> 
>> Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
>> claim.
>> 
>> Please visit our web site at
>> 
>
www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringeme
>> nt%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf
>>  
>> Legal Response Team
>> THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
>> 
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Dan Gaul [mailto:dan@digitaltrends.com]
>> Sent: Wednesday, March 07, 2007 5:01 PM
>> To: zzzzzz
>> Cc: adsense-abuse@google.com; abuse@google.com
>> Subject: FW: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3378344F] FW: Invalid use of
copyrighted
>> material
>> 
>> I'll re-iterate my case to your department.
>> 
>> My name is Dan Gaul.  I'm co-owner of Designtechnica Corporation,
> which
>> owns
>> Digitaltrends.com.
>> 
>> We are a customer of EV1 (rs-120096-2) and a previous customer of The
>> Planet
>> before moving to EV1.
>> 
>> A current customer of The Planet has a website which has multiple
>> copyrighted material of Digital Trends (in fact all of their content
> is
>> ripped off from other sites) on their site without permission or
>> recognition
>> to the original copyright holder, Digital Trends.
>> 
>> The link to some of the offending pages are:
>> http://www.gadgetinsight.com/2006/11/04/Gateway-NX100X.html
>> http://www.gadgetinsight.com/2007/03/01/Toshiba-HD-XA2.html
>> 
>> Our original stories:
>> http://reviews.digitaltrends.com/review3753.html
>> http://reviews.digitaltrends.com/review4383.html
>> 
>> They also claim copyright on the material based on the footer.
>> 
>> Looking at their other stories, it seems all their content is ripped
> of
>> and
>> used to generate money from Google AdSense.  For example:
>> http://www.gadgetinsight.com/2007/03/03/Wolverine-PMP.html
>> Compared to:
>> http://www.turbogadgets.com/2007/03/02/wolverine-pmp-huge-160gb-hdd/
>> 
>> 
>
http://www.gadgetinsight.com/2007/03/07/ThermoHAWK-200-Touchless-Thermom
>> eter
>> .html
>> Compared to
>> http://www.i4u.com/article8140.html
>> 
>> http://www.gadgetinsight.com/bloger/Blogging-Maria.html?page=1
>> Compared to:
>> 
>
http://www.coolest-gadgets.com/20070301/eco-kettle-multi-chamber-kettle-
>> save
>> s-money/
>> 
>> I've CC'd Google AdSense's abuse department and abuse@google.com
>> 
>> I appreciate your cooperation.
>> 
>> -dan

-- 
Dan Gaul
Digital Trends
dan@digitaltrends.com
http://www.digitaltrends.com/
503.342.2890 ext. 83
